verses.roman:
bhūmir uvāca
namas te deva-deveśa
śaṅkha-cakra-gadā-dhara
bhaktecchopātta-rūpāya
paramātman namo 'stu te

synonyms: bhūmiḥ uvāca—the earth-goddess said; namaḥ—obeisances; te—unto You; deva-deva—of the lords of the demigods; īśa—O Lord; śaṅkha—of the conchshell; cakra—disc; gadā—and club; dhara—O holder; bhakta—of Your devotees; icchā—by the desire; upātta—who have assumed; rūpāya—Your forms; parama-ātman—O Supreme Soul; namaḥ—obeisances; astu—let there be; te—unto You.
translation: Goddess Bhūmi said: Obeisances unto You, O Lord of the chief demigods, O holder of the conchshell, disc and club. O Supreme Soul within the heart, You assume Your various forms to fulfill Your devotees' desires. Obeisances unto You.
